slides.title: Welcome to Cost Management
slides.content:
# Cost Management

Part 1D covers **cost accounting** systems and techniques.

## What You Will Learn

- **Costing Systems** - Job, process, hybrid
- **ABC** - Activity-based costing
- **Lean** - JIT and lean manufacturing
- **Supply Chain** - Cost optimization

## Topics

| Area | Focus |
|------|-------|
| Costing systems | Methods |
| ABC/ABM | Activities |
| Lean operations | Efficiency |
| Supply chain | Integrated cost |

slides.title: Job Order Costing
slides.content:
# Job Costing

## When Used

- Custom products
- Unique orders
- Service industries

## Cost Tracking

```
Job Cost Sheet:
- Direct materials
- Direct labor
- Applied overhead
= Total job cost
```

## Overhead Application

```
Predetermined OH Rate = Est. OH / Est. Activity

Applied OH = Actual Activity x POHR
```

## Over/Under Applied

```
Applied OH - Actual OH = Difference

Positive = Over-applied
Negative = Under-applied
```

slides.title: Process Costing
slides.content:
# Process Costing

## When Used

- Continuous production
- Homogeneous products
- Mass manufacturing

## Equivalent Units

```
Complete units + (WIP x % complete)
= Equivalent units
```

## Cost per Equivalent Unit

```
Total costs / Equivalent units
= Cost per equivalent unit
```

## Methods

| Method | WIP Treatment |
|--------|---------------|
| FIFO | Separate BOP |
| Weighted average | Combined |

slides.title: Costing Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Process costing uses what concept for WIP?

slides.title: Activity-Based Costing
slides.content:
# ABC Costing

## Traditional vs ABC

| Traditional | ABC |
|-------------|-----|
| Volume-based | Activity-based |
| Single rate | Multiple pools |
| Less accurate | More accurate |

## ABC Process

```
1. Identify activities
2. Assign costs to pools
3. Select cost drivers
4. Calculate rates
5. Apply to products
```

## Cost Drivers

| Activity | Driver |
|----------|--------|
| Setup | Number of setups |
| Inspection | Number inspected |
| Purchasing | Number of orders |
| Storage | Square footage |

slides.title: Activity-Based Management
slides.content:
# ABM

## Value vs Non-Value Activities

| Value-Added | Non-Value |
|-------------|----------|
| Customer pays for | Customer won't pay |
| Transforms product | Waste |
| Necessary | Eliminate |

## Operational ABM

- Improve efficiency
- Reduce non-value
- Process improvement

## Strategic ABM

- Product mix
- Pricing decisions
- Customer analysis

## Benefits

- Better costing
- Process improvement
- Strategic decisions

slides.title: Target Costing
slides.content:
# Target Costing

## Market-Driven Pricing

```
Target Price (market)
- Target Profit
= Target Cost
```

## Cost Gap

```
Estimated Cost - Target Cost = Gap

Must close gap to be profitable
```

## Cost Reduction

| Technique | Focus |
|-----------|-------|
| Value engineering | Design changes |
| Supplier involvement | Input costs |
| Process improvement | Efficiency |

## Kaizen Costing

- Continuous improvement
- Production phase
- Incremental reductions

slides.title: Lean Manufacturing
slides.content:
# Lean Principles

## Seven Wastes

| Waste | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| Overproduction | Making too much |
| Waiting | Idle time |
| Transport | Unnecessary movement |
| Processing | Excess work |
| Inventory | Excess stock |
| Motion | Unnecessary movement |
| Defects | Quality issues |

## Lean Tools

| Tool | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| 5S | Organization |
| Kanban | Visual control |
| Kaizen | Continuous improvement |
| Value stream | Flow analysis |

slides.title: Lean Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: How many wastes are identified in lean manufacturing?

slides.title: JIT Manufacturing
slides.content:
# Just-In-Time

## JIT Principles

- Produce when needed
- Minimize inventory
- Pull system
- Quality focus

## Benefits

| Benefit | Impact |
|---------|--------|
| Lower inventory | Less capital |
| Less waste | Cost savings |
| Quality | Fewer defects |
| Flexibility | Responsiveness |

## Requirements

- Reliable suppliers
- Flexible workforce
- Quality processes
- Continuous improvement

## Risks

- Supply disruption
- Demand variability

slides.title: Theory of Constraints
slides.content:
# TOC

## Bottleneck Focus

The constraint limits system output.

## TOC Process

```
1. Identify constraint
2. Exploit constraint
3. Subordinate everything
4. Elevate constraint
5. Repeat
```

## Throughput Accounting

```
Throughput = Sales - Material cost

Throughput per constraint hour
= Ranking for decisions
```

## Key Measures

| Measure | Formula |
|---------|--------|
| Throughput | Sales - Materials |
| Inventory | All money invested |
| Operating expense | All other costs |

slides.title: Life Cycle Costing
slides.content:
# Life Cycle Costs

## Product Life Cycle

```
Development -> Introduction -> Growth -> Maturity -> Decline
```

## Cost Categories

| Phase | Costs |
|-------|-------|
| Development | R&D, design |
| Production | Manufacturing |
| Support | Maintenance |
| Disposal | Retirement |

## Benefits

- Full cost visibility
- Better decisions
- Long-term focus

## Total Cost of Ownership

- Purchase price
- Operating costs
- Maintenance
- Disposal

slides.title: Supply Chain Costing
slides.content:
# Supply Chain Costs

## Cost Categories

| Category | Examples |
|----------|----------|
| Procurement | Ordering, receiving |
| Production | Manufacturing |
| Distribution | Shipping, handling |
| Inventory | Holding costs |

## Total Cost of Ownership

```
Purchase price
+ Ordering costs
+ Holding costs
+ Quality costs
+ Shortage costs
= Total ownership cost
```

## Supplier Evaluation

- Price
- Quality
- Delivery
- Service
- Financial stability

slides.title: Supply Chain Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Total cost of ownership includes purchase price plus?

slides.title: Joint and By-Products
slides.content:
# Joint Costing

## Split-Off Point

Where products become separately identifiable.

## Allocation Methods

| Method | Basis |
|--------|-------|
| Physical units | Quantity |
| Sales value | Revenue at split |
| NRV | Final sales - Further processing |

## By-Products

| Treatment | Method |
|-----------|--------|
| Revenue | Credit to main product |
| Cost offset | Reduce joint cost |

## Further Processing

```
Process if:
Incremental revenue > Incremental cost
```

slides.title: Environmental Costing
slides.content:
# Environmental Costs

## Cost Categories

| Category | Examples |
|----------|----------|
| Prevention | Audits, training |
| Detection | Monitoring, testing |
| Internal failure | Cleanup, rework |
| External failure | Fines, remediation |

## Full Cost Accounting

- Include environmental costs
- Assign to activities/products
- Make visible

## Benefits

- Better decisions
- Regulatory compliance
- Reputation
- Sustainability
